questions.questionText: A car covers 180 km in 3 hours. What is its speed?
A train traveling at 54 km/h covers a certain distance in 4 hours. What is the distance?
A person travels from A to B at 60 km/h and returns at 40 km/h. What is the average speed?
questions.explanation: For equal distances: Average Speed = (2 × 60 × 40) / (60 + 40) = 4800 / 100 = 48 km/h.

questions.questionText: Two cars are moving in opposite directions at 40 km/h and 50 km/h. What is their relative speed?
questions.explanation: For opposite directions: Relative Speed = 40 + 50 = 90 km/h.

questions.questionText: A train 150m long crosses a pole in 15 seconds. What is its speed in km/h?
A train 200m long crosses a platform 300m long in 25 seconds. Find its speed in m/s.
Two trains 100m and 150m long are running at 45 km/h and 36 km/h in opposite directions. How long will they take to cross each other?
questions.explanation: Total distance = 100 + 150 = 250m. Relative speed = 45 + 36 = 81 km/h = 22.5 m/s. Time = 250 / 22.5 = 11.11 seconds.

questions.questionText: A boat's downstream speed is 16 km/h and upstream speed is 10 km/h. Find the speed of the stream.
A boat can travel at 18 km/h in still water. The stream flows at 4 km/h. What is the downstream speed?
questions.explanation: Downstream speed = Speed in still water + Stream speed = 18 + 4 = 22 km/h.

questions.questionText: A person walks at 5 km/h and reaches 15 minutes late. If he walks at 6 km/h, he reaches 5 minutes early. What is the distance?
questions.explanation: Time difference = 15 + 5 = 20 minutes = 1/3 hour. Distance × (1/5 - 1/6) = 1/3. Distance × (1/30) = 1/3. Distance = 10 km.

questions.questionText: Two people start from points 100 km apart and travel towards each other at 30 km/h and 20 km/h. When will they meet?
A man covers half the distance at 60 km/h and the remaining half at 40 km/h. What is his average speed?
questions.explanation: For equal distances: Average Speed = (2 × 60 × 40) / (60 + 40) = 4800 / 100 = 48 km/h.

questions.questionText: A train running at 90 km/h passes a bridge in 30 seconds. If the length of the train is 250m, what is the length of the bridge?
questions.explanation: Speed = 90 km/h = 25 m/s. Distance = 25 × 30 = 750m. Bridge length = 750 - 250 = 500m.

questions.questionText: A boat takes 4 hours downstream and 6 hours upstream to cover the same distance. If the speed of stream is 2 km/h, find the speed of boat in still water.
questions.explanation: Let distance = d, boat speed = b. d/(b+2) = 4 and d/(b-2) = 6. From both: 4(b+2) = 6(b-2), 4b+8 = 6b-12, 2b = 20, b = 10 km/h.

questions.questionText: Two trains start from stations A and B towards each other at 50 km/h and 40 km/h. If the distance between A and B is 270 km, when will they meet?
A person travels equal distances at 30 km/h, 40 km/h, and 60 km/h. Find the average speed.
If a man increases his speed from 10 km/h to 12 km/h, he takes 10 minutes less to cover a certain distance. What is the distance?
